messages.message:
Change to how we build protos for Python

Prior to this PR, we built protos in Python every time we did “make build”. This added a latency of 5 - 15 seconds per “make build”.

To enhance developer productivity, protos are now built in a separate command called “make build-protos”https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/9632

Therefore, everytime you modify a .proto file, cd into the service which depends on that .proto file, and then “make build-protos”.

I will soon add a pre-submit check that ensures that you ran “make build-protos” if you update a .proto file and forget to update the corresponding generated .py.

Try it out and see how “make build” feels now in Python services!
